title: Bribery DG’s wife worked for Arjuna Mahendran : MP
byline: The opposition yesterday came out with yet another serious allegation against Committee to Investigate Allegations on Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) Director General Ranga Dissanayake stating that his wife had worked for one time Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran.

title: Preschooler drowns during swimming lesson
byline: A 5-year-old child studying at a private school in Mirihana died after drowning during a swimming lesson.

title: Israel and Hamas agree to Gaza ceasefire and return of hostages
byline: Israel and Hamas said they had agreed to a long-awaited ceasefire and hostage deal, the first phase of U.S. President Donald Trump’s plan to end a war in Gaza that has killed more than 67,000 people and reshaped the Middle East.

title: Vehicle imports surge – Less taker
byline: Vehicle importers have reported a slowdown in demand for new vehicle purchases following a surge in imports over the past several months. They said the influx of vehicles brought in to meet pent-up demand after years of restrictions has now led to a cooling-off period, as the initial rush of buyers have subsided.

title: 2024 G.C.E. (O/L) re-exam results released
byline: The Department of Examinations has announced that the re-examination results of the 2024 G.C.E. (Ordinary Level) Examination have been released.

title: Bangladesh clubs to boycott matches over cricket board election
byline: A group of leading cricket clubs announced Wednesday a boycott of all domestic competitions, alleging widespread irregularities and government interference during the recent election of the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB).

title: Man falls asleep during tree protest
byline: A man who is said to be the Kalutara District Organiser of the Ape Jana Bala Pakshaya was rescued by Fire Department personnel after he fell asleep on top of a coconut tree which he had climbed in protest of the current economic difficulties being faced in the country.

title: UK signs $606 million deal to supply India with missiles
byline: Britain said on Oct 9 it had signed a £350 million (S$606 million) contract to supply the Indian army with UK-manufactured lightweight missiles, as part of a deepening weapons and defence partnership between the two countries.

title: Daily Mirror article on Easter Sunday attacks causes uproar in Parliament
byline: The Daily Mirror article under the title ’Main conspirator behind Easter Sunday attacks identified, Kariapper quotes Ravi Seneviratna’ came to the limelight in Parliament today.

title: Monthly safety checks made mandatory for long-distance buses
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) has announced that buses operating on long-distance routes must undergo a quality inspection every month, with the inspection certificate required to be kept inside the vehicle for verification.

title: Ravi Seneviratne denies social media claims on Easter Sunday attacks
byline: The Ministry of Public Security has strongly rejected social media reports claiming that its Secretary, retired Senior DIG Ravi Seneviratne, had stated India was behind the 2019 Easter Sunday bomb attacks.

title: Information on Easter Sunday attack probes should not be disclosed: Justice Minister
byline: Information with regard to the investigations into the Easter Sunday bomb attacks should not be disclosed as investigations are still ongoing, Justice Minister Harshana Nanayakkara said today.

title: Phones seized from cells of ’Dematagoda Chaminda’, ’Wele Suda’
byline: A total of 29 mobile phones were recovered today from wards A, C and D of the Boossa High-Security Prison, which houses some of Sri Lanka’s most notorious criminals.

title: Samantha Vidyaratna files complaint over online attacks targeting his child
byline: Minister of Plantation and Community Infrastructure Samantha Vidyaratna appeared before the Cyber Crimes Division of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) today to lodge a complaint over online attacks directed at his child.

title: Main conspirator behind Easter Sunday attacks identified: Kariapper quotes Ravi Seneviratna
byline: Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) MP Nizam Kariapper said that Secretary to the Ministry of Public Security Ravi Seneviratna has revealed that the main conspirator behind the Easter Sunday bomb attacks has been identified.

title: Colombo Port records Rs. 32.2 Bn profit in 2025
byline: The Port of Colombo has reported a record net profit of Rs. 32.2 billion for the first eight months of 2025 — a 71% increase from Rs. 18.9 billion recorded during the same period in 2024, the Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA) announced.

title: Backhoe Saman’s wife further remanded
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama today ordered that Shadhika Lakshani, the wife of Backhoe Saman, who is currently in custody, be further remanded till October 23 under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

title: Provincial Council elections will be held next year: Minister
byline: The Provincial Council elections will be held next year, Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Hearth told Parliament today.

title: Truth and Reconciliation Commission Bill to be presented to Parliament soon: Minister
byline: A Bill to set up a Truth and Reconciliation Commission will be presented to Parliament soon, Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath told Parliament today.

title: PM pays tribute to Election Commission
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya today paid tribute to the Election Commission for  being named the Electoral Commission of the Year at the 2025 International Electoral Awards Ceremony held in Gaborone, Botswana on Friday (October 3).

title: Wimal Weerawansa arrives at Tangalle police
byline: Former Minister Wimal Weerawansa arrived at the Tangalle Divisional Criminal Investigation Bureau for a statement to be recorded this morning.

title: Sevangala sugar factory to be turned into a public-private partnership: Deputy Minister
byline: The Sevangala sugar factory is  to be converted into a public-private partnership in order to make the maximum use of the available resources of the entity, Deputy Minister Chathuranga Abeysinghe told Parliament today.

title: Gammanpila appears before Bribery Commission
byline: Udaya Gammanpila, leader of the Pivithuru Hela Urumaya and former Member of Parliament, appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) this morning.

title: IMF reaches staff-level agreement with Sri Lanka on fifth review
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) and the Sri Lankan authorities have reached a staff-level agreement on economic policies to conclude the Fifth Review of Sri Lanka’s reform program under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF).

title: Former envoy warns: ’This rally won’t last forever’
byline: Gold fever has gripped the globe once again. The metal that built empires and calmed crises has smashed through $4,000 an ounce, its highest level in history — the boldest surge since the 1970s.

title: Vehicle imports surge – Less takers
byline: Vehicle importers have reported a slowdown in demand for new vehicle purchases following a surge in imports over the past several months. They said the influx of vehicles brought in to meet pent-up demand after years of restrictions has now led to a cooling-off period, as the initial rush of buyers have subsided.

title: Pavithra Fernando New Rugby Chief
byline: Former Sri Lanka rugby forward Pavithra Fernando was elected as the President of Sri Lanka Rugby at an election of office bearers held at the Duncan White Auditorium of the Ministry of Sports in Colombo today defeating Lasitha Gunaratne who held the top post some years ago.

title: Tesla investigated over self-driving cars driving on wrong side of road
byline: Tesla is being investigated by the US government after reports the firm’s self-driving cars had broken traffic laws, including driving on the wrong side of the road and not stopping for red lights.

title: Pope Leo invokes criticism of Trump’s policies in first major document
byline: Pope Leo made an urgent plea for the world to help immigrants in his first major document, which was released on Thursday and invoked one of the late Pope Francis’ strongest criticisms of U.S. President Donald Trump’s anti-immigration policies.

title: CSE rebounds with robust turnover: banking counters lead gains
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) opened on a positive note, recovering from yesterday’s decline and providing fresh momentum to the market. The ASPI gained 76.75 points (+0.35%) to 22,174.74, driven by a robust turnover of LKR 13.30 Bn.

title: Digital eye strain on the rise among working adult
byline: Health experts warn that cases of computer vision syndrome (CVS), also known as digital eye strain, are on the rise among adults aged 20 to 45. The increase is linked to more people working from home and studying online, a trend that expanded significantly during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Nobel Prize in literature awarded to Hungarian writer Laszlo Krasznahorkai
byline: The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences has awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in literature to Hungarian novelist and screenwriter Laszlo Krasznahorkai.

title: Court warns public servants to be “disciplined and honest”; fake director sentenced
byline: A man who had posed as veteran film director Somaratne Dissanayake, promising young women opportunities in cinema and television, and who was found guilty of committing sexual abuse and financial fraud, was today sentenced to eight months’ rigorous imprisonment with hard labour, suspended for ten years, by Chief Magistrate Asanka S. Bodaragama.

title: Sri Lanka Stuns Turkmenistan with Historic Win
byline: Sri Lanka today recorded a historic 1–0 victory over the higher-ranked Turkmenistan team in their AFC Asia Cup (Saudi Arabia 2027 Qualifiers) – Group ‘D’ first-leg encounter, played at the Race Course Ground, Colombo.

title: Several social media users in hot water over posts on Trade Minister
byline: The Ministry of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Cooperative Development has lodged a complaint with the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) over a series of false and defamatory posts circulating on social media against Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe and his public relations officer, Nimodie Wickramasinghe.

title: Two police officers interdicted
byline: A Sub Inspector and a Sergeant attached to the Anuradhapura police were interdicted last morning after a suspect had escaped from the police cell.

title: Police make arrest in India cough syrup deaths
byline: Police in India have arrested the owner of a pharmaceutical company that manufactures a cough syrup connected to the deaths of at least 17 children in the country.

title: Two children missing
byline: Two boys from the Thennakumbura area in Kandy, both 13 years of age, have gone missing from home.

title: Suwa Seriya name, logo to be changed: Harsha
byline: Samagi Jana Balavegaya (SJB) MP Harsha de Silva today  sounded an alarm over a move to change the name and logo of the Suwa Seriya ambulance service.
